traits.healed_follower: Listed among the women who followed Jesus and supported him from their resources, noted as one from whom seven demons had gone out.
traits.presence_at_crucifixion: Named among the women watching from a distance at the crucifixion, in contrast to most male disciples who have fled.
traits.witness_to_burial: Observes where Jesus is laid in the tomb, providing continuity between death and resurrection accounts.
traits.first_at_tomb: Goes to the tomb early on the first day of the week, encounters the empty tomb and angelic message, and is commissioned to tell the disciples.
traits.narrative_role: Serves as a key female disciple and early witness whose testimony the male disciples initially meet with fear or incredulity.

traits.mourning_at_tomb: Comes early to the tomb while it is still dark, finds the stone removed, and informs Peter and the beloved disciple.
traits.encounter_with_risen_jesus: Weeps outside the tomb, encounters the risen Jesus whom she at first mistakes for the gardener, and recognizes him when he speaks her name.
traits.commission_as_messenger: Receives the commission to announce to the disciples that Jesus is ascending to his Father and their Father, becoming 'apostle to the apostles' in later Christian language.
traits.critical_note: Later Western tradition often conflated Mary Magdalene with other unnamed sinful or anointing women, but the canonical Gospels present her distinctly as a healed and faithful witness.
